channel.title: Jar problem with hybrid pvp client
channel.description: I have no idea what im doing wrong, Ive tryed multiple tutorials and it still i get this error when client is loading. connecting error - retrying in 30 seconds.

item.source: Jar problem with hybrid pvp client

item.title: Jar problem with hybrid pvp client
item.dc:creator: @rsg0d rsg0d
item.description:
@rsg0d wrote:

Dextrell:

If it’s hybrid pvp v2 remember right click choose sundar zip archive go to your cache and select everything inside anddrag it to the winrar zip advice then upload it to dropbox and change the cache download URL at cachedownloader.java then you’re error must be in connecting to file server go to client.java and find connectingto fileserver under that there should be a URL with the cache link download make sure that is replaced with your cache URL and if it’s not there then it must be connecting to your server then if that’s the case make sure you are port forwarded correctly and your no-ip is up and you server if it still doesn’t work go to your serer files and in client.java (server sided I believe) search for 0.0.0.0 And replace that with your no-ip do that as well for the next addresses next to server = remember to search for server =

im sorry i must be explaining wrong, I mean the client and everything works perfectly, but when i try to jar the client (witch I use jar maker) then when I try to run the jar file it does that.

Read full topic
item.source: Jar problem with hybrid pvp client

item.title: Jar problem with hybrid pvp client
item.dc:creator: @Dextrell Dextrell
item.description:
@Dextrell wrote:

If it’s hybrid pvp v2 remember right click choose sundar zip archive go to your cache and select everything inside anddrag it to the winrar zip advice then upload it to dropbox and change the cache download URL at cachedownloader.java then you’re error must be in connecting to file server go to client.java and find connectingto fileserver under that there should be a URL with the cache link download make sure that is replaced with your cache URL and if it’s not there then it must be connecting to your server then if that’s the case make sure you are port forwarded correctly and your no-ip is up and you server if it still doesn’t work go to your serer files and in client.java (server sided I believe) search for 0.0.0.0 And replace that with your no-ip do that as well for the next addresses next to server = remember to search for server =

Read full topic
